sub_topic: Numerical differentiation and integration using finite difference methods
message_1: Find the numerical approximation of the derivative of f(x) = 5x^3 - 2x^2 + 3x - 1 at x = 2 using the forward, backward, and central difference methods with a step size of h = 0.1. Also, estimate the error for each method.
message_2:
To find the numerical approximation of the derivative of f(x) = 5x^3 - 2x^2 + 3x - 1 at x = 2 using the forward, backward, and central difference methods with a step size of h = 0.1, we'll first define the function and then apply each method.

Function: f(x) = 5x^3 - 2x^2 + 3x - 1

Forward difference method:
f'(x) ≈ (f(x + h) - f(x)) / h
f'(2) ≈ (f(2.1) - f(2)) / 0.1

f(2.1) = 5(2.1)^3 - 2(2.1)^2 + 3(2.1) - 1 = 47.259
f(2) = 5(2)^3 - 2(2)^2 + 3(2) - 1 = 33
f'(2) ≈ (47.259 - 33) / 0.1 = 142.59

Backward difference method:
f'(x) ≈ (f(x) - f(x - h)) / h
f'(2) ≈ (f(2) - f(1.9)) / 0.1

f(1.9) = 5(1.9)^3 - 2(1.9)^2 + 3(1.9) - 1 = 20.759
f'(2) ≈ (33 - 20.759) / 0.1 = 122.41

Central difference method:
f'(x) ≈ (f(x + h) - f(x - h)) / (2h)
f'(2) ≈ (f(2.1) - f(1.9)) / 0.2

f'(2) ≈ (47.259 - 20.759) / 0.2 = 132.5

Now, let's find the exact derivative and the error for each method:

Exact derivative: f'(x) = 15x^2 - 4x + 3
f'(2) = 15(2)^2 - 4(2) + 3 = 135

Error estimation:
Forward difference error: |142.59 - 135| = 7.59
Backward difference error: |122.41 - 135| = 12.59
Central difference error: |132.5 - 135| = 2.5

So, the numerical approximations of the derivative at x = 2 using the forward, backward, and central difference methods are 142.59, 122.41, and 132.5, respectively, with errors of 7.59, 12.59, and 2.5.
